text: Ben F. Wilson (also credited Benjamin Wilson; July 7, 1876 - August 25, 1930), was an American stage and film actor, director, producer and screenwriter of the silent era.The Actors Birthday Book by Johnson Briscoe, this edition c. 1908 Retrieved March 24, 2016 He appeared in 212 films between 1911 and 1930. He also directed 138 films between 1912 and 1930. He was born in Corning, Iowa in 1876, and died in Glendale, California in 1930 from heart disease. ==Selected filmography== * Silver Threads Among the Gold (1911) * The Star Spangled Banner (1911) * The Battle of Bunker Hill (1911) * To Save Her Brother (1912) * For the Cause of the South (1912) * The Charge of the Light Brigade (1912) * The Passing of J.B.
